A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: As a fan since childhood\, the first Star Wars i saw was the release of Empire Strikes Back around 1997\, I then grew up watching 1 2 ad 3\, which I genuinely liked\, only being a child of around 10 for Phantom menace. I have always enjoyed the movies even 7 and Rogue One were great\, this is the first time I'm actually quite disappointed in a Star Wars film\, and thats saying a lot. \n\nFrom the weird Mary Poppins\, to the pointless side plots and rushed character development of Rey\, it all had so much potential but felt underwhelming. I hope 9 makes up for this or somebody remakes 8.
